metadata.title: Accidental Tech Podcast
metadata.author: Marco Arment, Casey Liss, John Siracusa
metadata.description: Three nerds discussing tech, Apple, programming, and loosely related matters.

episodes.title: 623: It‚Äôs About Human Connection
episodes.subtitle: Nerdy home-buying considerations, Hyperspace updates, the surprisingly difficult engineering challenge of scrolling, and how we're going to get through all of this.
episodes.description:
• Pre-show: #GALP üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà‚ù§Ô∏èüè≥Ô∏è‚Äç‚ößÔ∏è
    • Jeff Atwood: Stay Gold, America
  • Follow-up:
    • Apple pauses notification summaries for news apps
    • Marco‚Äôs BMW does have dual-screen CarPlay
    • Acura RSX: Honda‚Äôs first all-original EV
    • Another 5K monitor enters the arena: ViewSonic VP2788-5K
      • Thom Bullock‚Äôs tweet
      • As per Dave Hamilton (of Mag Geek Gab), $800!
    • Fast directory sizing lives!
      • /System/Library/Filesystems/apfs.fs/Contents/Resources/apfs.util
      • man apfs.util
    • Apple sample code is on GitHub (via David R√∂nnqvist)
      • Backyard Birds
      • Food Truck
    • Video of an iPhone 16 Pro upgrade 128¬†GB ‚Üí 1¬†TB (via Joe Beninato)
      • Also on YouTube
    • Tim Cook on Table Manners with Jessie & Lennie Ware
      • Overcast link
  • Hyperspace updates
    • Van Halen‚Äôs Brown M&Ms
    • John‚Äôs Hyperspace Instructions
  • Ask ATP:
    • What should a nerd consider when buying a house? (via Jeremy Kelleher)
      • MoCA
  • Post-show: Casey‚Äôs Rube Goldberg machine‚Ä¶¬†simplified?
    • ATP #376: Monogamous Gaming Lifestyle
    • Raspberry Pi Zero WH
    • UDP
    • Homebridge
    • Home Assistant
    • MQTT
      • Mosquitto
    • Eric Welander
  • Members-only ATP Overtime: Nintendo Switch 2 announced
    • The Verge coverage

Sponsored by:

  • DeleteMe: Making it quick, easy and safe to remove your personal data online. Use code ATP.
  • Squarespace: Save 10% off your first purchase of a website or domain using code ATP.

episodes.title: 622: Duplicate Garbage Generation Process
episodes.subtitle: New Mac-monitor possibilities, Tim Cook's political moves, and updates on John's app‚Ä¶¬†which now has a name!
episodes.description:
• Follow-up:
    • AirPod noises
      • Gui Rambo & AirBuddy
      • One of the noises is ‚Äúthe case battery is low‚Äù (via Zach)
        • Also, more on status lights (via Tom French)
      • Another noise is a calibration noise (via Ian Williamson)
        • Knowledge base
      • How to turn off charging sounds
      • Look, ma! We‚Äôre famous!
      • AirPod Noises (via Patch)
    • TVs at CES 2025
      • Hisense‚Äôs 116UX with RGB mini-backlight
        • Digital Trends coverage
        • HDTVTest coverage
      • DLSS
        • History (via Hampus Jensen)
        • Explanation (via flunkedflank)
        • Digital Foundry explanation video
    • Mac monitors
      • Some foreign options (via Henry Chen)
        • MacRumors thread
        • Kuycon G27-X
      • Another option (via Tim Ngwena)
        • Asus ProArt Display 6K PA32QCV
        • Quick look video
        • DisplayHDR 600 spec
    • Dynamic Island Live Alert (via Dan Engler)
  • ü§Æ Tim Cook donates $1 million to Trump inauguration ü§Æ
    • The Verge
    • Google and Microsoft join in
    • Citizens United
    • Nvidia bends a knee
    • Charles Erwin Wilson‚Äôs nomination for Secretary of Defense
  • TestFlight subscriptions on macOS
  • TestFlight for ATP members
    • Name reveal
    • Manage subscriptions API
  • Marco and Casey price John‚Äôs app
  • Post-show Neutral:
    • Winter report card for Tina‚Äôs Civic
    • Casey has connected Erin‚Äôs car to Home Assistant
    • Marco‚Äôs new[-ish] car update
  • Members-only ATP Overtime: Honda EVs at CES
    • Afeela (Honda ü§ùüèª Sony) 1
    • Honda Zero
      • Ars Technica
    • Acura NSX
    • F-4 Phantom II
    • F-16 Fighting Falcon

Sponsored by:

  • Members like you! Become a member for ad-free episodes, member specials, and our early-release, unedited ‚Äúbootleg‚Äù feed!

episodes.title: 621: I'll Meet You Any Time You Want
episodes.subtitle: Breaking news and in-depth coverage from our reporter at CES.
episodes.description:
• Pre-show: Our AirPods are trying to talk to us but we can‚Äôt understand them
    • 20k Hz
      • The Sound of Apple 1.0
      • The Sound of Apple 2.0
      • Auto-Tone (Rivian)
    • statuslight.com
  • Follow-up:
    • That gas car review post that Marco was thinking of
      • Former example
      • Actual link we couldn‚Äôt [previously] find (via K)
      • Another example
      • And another
    • The Find My app can make Macs make noise (via Miles)
    • Maybe iOS 18‚Äôs Photos app isn‚Äôt all bad? (via Tim Luft)
    • The Magic Mouse
      • The Apology Mouse did not have side buttons
      • The Mighty Mouse did
      • MKBHD‚Äôs blind ranking interview with Tim Cook
        • Editorialized reel
      • What will the new one be?
        • Ridiculous mouse rumor
          • Gurman‚Äôs take
          • Hello, Computer
        • Death to buttons?
        • Death to ports? (In the name of handedness)
        • Maybe ape the Logitech MX Anywhere? (via Karan J)
        • Perhaps a common charging approach?
    • Apple already makes Wi-Fi & Bluetooth chips (via Ian Williamson)
    • Meshtastic is another application for John and Casey‚Äôs new favorite thing, LoRa (via James Andrews)
  • CES 2025
    • TVs
      • What‚Äôs John got his eyes on?
      • Sony üíî
      • Samsung‚Äôs new QD-OLED
        • HDTVTest
        • Digital Trends
      • LG‚Äôs flagship goes MLA ‚Üí Tandem OLED
        • Microlens
        • Tandem OLED
      • Panasonic talks about the new LG panel
        • ‚ÄúPrimary RGB Tandem OLED Panel‚Äù
        • HDTVTest on the Z95B
      • More ‚ÄúAI‚Äù coming to TVs ‚òπÔ∏è
      • Big TVs are big
    • LG Unveils UltraFine 6K Display with Thunderbolt 5
      • Recent ATP Overtime on monitors was in Episode #618
      • Dell UltraSharp 32¬†6K Monitor ‚ÄúU3224KB‚Äù
    • Dell no longer makes XPS computers
      • Mocked at their own launch is not a great look
      • Engadget‚Äôs take
    • Nvidia‚Äôs announcements
      • Nvidia announces RTX 5090 and 5080 GPUs
        • DLSS 4
          • Explainer video from Nvidia
        • Deep learning super sampling
        • John‚Äôs post featuring a video about the responsiveness of touch interfaces
      • Nvidia AI supercomputer ‚ÄúDigits‚Äù
      • ~~Concepts of~~ a plan for desktop CPU
  • TestFlight access to John‚Äôs app is [likely] coming for ATP members only
  • Post-show:
    • Thanks, Patrons üíô
    • Marco bought something.
      • HDCP
  • Members-only ATP Overtime: Apple Intelligence summaries may get warning labels
    • BBC report 1 and report 2
    • Apple‚Äôs response
    • Allen Pike‚Äôs Apple Intelligence evaluation

Sponsored by:

  • DeleteMe: Making it quick, easy and safe to remove your personal data online.
  • Wildgrain: Free croissants in every box and $30 off your first box.

Become a member for ATP Overtime, ad-free episodes, member specials, and our early-release, unedited ‚Äúbootleg‚Äù feed!
